engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Extending geometric space beyond the familiar three dimensions by compactifying additional spatial dimensions to enable a more comprehensive understanding of particle interactions and universe behavior.
Utilizing hidden or compactified dimensions within the fabric of the universe to affect particle dynamics and forces on scales not directly observable in the macroscopic world.
Relating interactions and properties of fundamental particles to the geometry of additional spatial dimensions to provide a unified explanation for the forces governing the universe.
